Description: A fragment of an amulet and 17 beads of different shape and material. A: Fragment of an amulet made of faience, no glaze preserved. Visible is the lower half of a standing figure, probably a goddess. B: Barrel-shaped bead made of white faience with a pearlescent glaze. C: One flattened sphere bead made of white faience. D: One segmented cylindrical bead made of turquoise faience, three segments preserved. E: 14 disc-shaped beads, two made of ostrich eggshell, the rest made of stone.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
